column3: As an aside, there are several shared libs that we build in order to link qt against, but that we don't actually ship. libfreetype is one of them. We should downgrade those to the minimum viable versions in order to detect these issues at build-time.
For reference, here's the current implementation in freetype's git:\nhttps://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/freetype/freetype2.git/tree/src/base/ftfntfmt.c
Would downgrading our freetype depends-build make this automagically work, or cause the Qt build to fail?

@luke-jr Should do the latter.\n\nIt would either fail to compile due to a missing ```FT_Get_Font_Format()``` definition, or if that happened to be hard-coded somewhere, it would fail to link due to the unresolved symbol.
Tested ACK 430bf6c7a1a24a59050e7c9dac56b64b820edb43 on Ubuntu 14.04.05 via a Gitian Build (https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/build/811).
